history.content:
Hello there, 

Since this is a data science question, I would recommend asking it in the DATA001 Piazza!

DATA001 at University of California, Berkeley (UC Berkeley) | Piazza

But definitely take Data 8! It's a great class (much better than STAT 20 and 21 in my opinion) and is also a requirement for the Data Science Major.

Hello there, 

Since this is a data science question, I would recommend asking it in the DATA001 Piazza!

DATA001 at University of California, Berkeley (UC Berkeley) | Piazza

children.subject: I'm also interested in switching my major to data science and had taken CS61A and Stat 20 previously. I took data 8x through edx this summer to see how much I was missing out on. I haven't taken an upper div data science course yet so I can't speak to which skills are most important, but I found data 8x to be really interesting. It did a great job of teaching how to apply cs to statistics concepts which is something you will miss if you take a pure statistics course since 61a or 61b doesn't cover it. In my opinion data 8 and 88 are worth the extra units if you don't have the motivation to learn the skills outside of class, otherwise data8x online concurrently with being enrolled in a statistics course could be another consideration. If I remember correctly, Stat 20 covered all of the stats concepts used in data 8.

history.content: I am an intended data science major. I have no background knowledge in statistics. I have taken cs61a and c61b. I currently am enrolled in data 8 and stat 88 for the fall semester but it has recently come to my attention that I can take another stats class instead to declare data science. I have heard that data 8 is a very fun class but i'm not sure if taking extra units is worth it. The stats classes I can take instead are stats 20, stats 21, stats 135 or stat 131a. Do you think it's a better option to take data 8 and stat 88 or take one of those stats classes instead? I am still very interested in CS but do not think I can declare at this point. I am also interested in data science but do not know a lot about the field.
history.subject: Data Science 8 + stat 88 vs stat 20, 21, 135 or 131A
